AudioListener.summary: The AudioListener interface represents the position and orientation of the unique person listening to the audio scene, and is used in audio spatialization. All s spatialize in relation to the AudioListener stored in the attribute.

remarks.para: It is important to note that there is only one listener per context and that it isn't an .

para.see: We see the position, up and front vectors of an AudioListener, with the up and front vectors at 90° from the other.

AudioListenerForwardX.summary: The forwardX read-only property of the interface is an representing the x value of the direction vector defining the forward direction the listener is pointing in.

blockquote.para: The parameter is a-rate when used with a whose is set to equalpower, or k-rate otherwise.

AudioListenerForwardX.value: An . Its default value is 0, and it can range between positive and negative infinity.

AudioListenerForwardY.summary: The forwardY read-only property of the interface is an representing the y value of the direction vector defining the forward direction the listener is pointing in.

blockquote.para: The parameter is a-rate when used with a whose is set to equalpower, or k-rate otherwise.

AudioListenerForwardY.value: An . Its default value is 0, and it can range between positive and negative infinity.

AudioListenerForwardZ.summary: The forwardZ read-only property of the interface is an representing the z value of the direction vector defining the forward direction the listener is pointing in.

blockquote.para: The parameter is a-rate when used with a whose is set to equalpower, or k-rate otherwise.

AudioListenerForwardZ.value: An . Its default value is -1, and it can range between positive and negative infinity.

AudioListenerPositionX.summary: The positionX read-only property of the interface is an representing the x position of the listener in 3D cartesian space.

blockquote.para: The parameter is a-rate when used with a whose is set to equalpower, or k-rate otherwise.

AudioListenerPositionX.value: An . Its default value is 0, and it can range between positive and negative infinity.

AudioListenerPositionY.summary: The positionY read-only property of the interface is an representing the y position of the listener in 3D cartesian space.

blockquote.para: The parameter is a-rate when used with a whose is set to equalpower, or k-rate otherwise.

AudioListenerPositionY.value: An . Its default value is 0, and it can range between positive and negative infinity.

AudioListenerPositionZ.summary: The positionZ read-only property of the interface is an representing the z position of the listener in 3D cartesian space.

blockquote.para: The parameter is a-rate when used with a whose is set to equalpower, or k-rate otherwise.

AudioListenerPositionZ.value: An . Its default value is 0, and it can range between positive and negative infinity.

AudioListenerSetOrientation.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The setOrientation() method of the interface defines the orientation of the listener.

remarks.para: It consists of two direction vectors:
The two vectors must be separated by an angle of 90° — in linear analysis terms, they must be perpendicular to each other.

AudioListenerSetPosition.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The setPosition() method of the Interface defines the position of the listener.

remarks.para: The three parameters x, y and z are unitless and describe the listener's position in 3D space according to the right-hand Cartesian coordinate system. objects use this position relative to individual audio sources for spatialization.
The default value of the position vector is (0, 0, 0).

blockquote.para: As this method is deprecated, use the three , , and properties instead.

AudioListenerUpX.summary: The upX read-only property of the interface is an representing the x value of the direction vector defining the up direction the listener is pointing in.

blockquote.para: The parameter is a-rate when used with a whose is set to equalpower, or k-rate otherwise.

AudioListenerUpX.value: An . Its default value is 0, and it can range between positive and negative infinity.

AudioListenerUpY.summary: The upY read-only property of the interface is an representing the y value of the direction vector defining the up direction the listener is pointing in.

blockquote.para: The parameter is a-rate when used with a whose is set to equalpower, or k-rate otherwise.

AudioListenerUpY.value: An . Its default value is 1, and it can range between positive and negative infinity.

AudioListenerUpZ.summary: The upZ read-only property of the interface is an representing the z value of the direction vector defining the up direction the listener is pointing in.

blockquote.para: The parameter is a-rate when used with a whose is set to equalpower, or k-rate otherwise.

AudioListenerUpZ.value: An . Its default value is 0, and it can range between positive and negative infinity.
